segment.source: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries
segment.target: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries

segment.source: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.
segment.target: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.

segment.source: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.
segment.target: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.

segment.source: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries
segment.target: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.
segment.target: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.

segment.source: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.
segment.target: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.

segment.source: A library is a virtual collection of folders, which includes a known folder by default plus any other folders the user has added to the library by using your app or one of the built-in apps.
segment.target: A library is a virtual collection of folders, which includes a known folder by default plus any other folders the user has added to the library by using your app or one of the built-in apps.

segment.source: For example, the Pictures library includes the Pictures known folder by default.
segment.target: For example, the Pictures library includes the Pictures known folder by default.

segment.source: The user can add folders to, or remove them from, the Pictures library by using your app or the built-in Photos app.
segment.target: The user can add folders to, or remove them from, the Pictures library by using your app or the built-in Photos app.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.
segment.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.

segment.source: Access permissions to the location
segment.target: Access permissions to the location

segment.source: In Visual Studio, open the app manifest file in Manifest Designer.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, open the app manifest file in Manifest Designer.

segment.source: On the Capabilities page, select the libraries that your app manages.
segment.target: On the Capabilities page, select the libraries that your app manages.

segment.source: Music Library
segment.target: Music Library

segment.source: Pictures Library
segment.target: Pictures Library

segment.source: Videos Library
segment.target: Videos Library

segment.source: To learn more, see File access permissions.
segment.target: To learn more, see File access permissions.

segment.source: Get a reference to a library
segment.target: Get a reference to a library

segment.source: Note Remember to declare the appropriate capability.
segment.target: Note Remember to declare the appropriate capability.

segment.source: To get a reference to the user's Music, Pictures, or Video library, call the StorageLibrary.GetLibraryAsync method.
segment.target: To get a reference to the user's Music, Pictures, or Video library, call the StorageLibrary.GetLibraryAsync method.

segment.source: Provide the corresponding value from the KnownLibraryId enumeration.
segment.target: Provide the corresponding value from the KnownLibraryId enumeration.

segment.source: KnownLibraryId.Music
segment.target: KnownLibraryId.Music

segment.source: KnownLibraryId.Pictures
segment.target: KnownLibraryId.Pictures

segment.source: KnownLibraryId.Videos
segment.target: KnownLibraryId.Videos

segment.source: Get the list of folders in a library
segment.target: Get the list of folders in a library

segment.source: To get the list of folders in a library, get the value of the StorageLibrary.Folders property.
segment.target: To get the list of folders in a library, get the value of the StorageLibrary.Folders property.

segment.source: Get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default
segment.target: Get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default

segment.source: To get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default, get the value of the StorageLibrary.SaveFolder property.
segment.target: To get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default, get the value of the StorageLibrary.SaveFolder property.

segment.source: Add an existing folder to a library
segment.target: Add an existing folder to a library

segment.source: To add a folder to a library, you call the StorageLibrary.RequestAddFolderAsync.
segment.target: To add a folder to a library, you call the StorageLibrary.RequestAddFolderAsync.

segment.source: Taking the Pictures Library as an example, calling this method causes a folder picker to be shown to the user with an Add this folder to Pictures button.
segment.target: Taking the Pictures Library as an example, calling this method causes a folder picker to be shown to the user with an Add this folder to Pictures button.

segment.source: If the user picks a folder then the folder remains in its original location on disk and it becomes an item in the StorageLibrary.Folders property (and in the built-in Photos app), but the folder does not appear as a child of the Pictures folder in File Explorer.
segment.target: If the user picks a folder then the folder remains in its original location on disk and it becomes an item in the StorageLibrary.Folders property (and in the built-in Photos app), but the folder does not appear as a child of the Pictures folder in File Explorer.

segment.source: Remove a folder from a library
segment.target: Remove a folder from a library

segment.source: To remove a folder from a library, call the StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync method and specify the folder to be removed.
segment.target: To remove a folder from a library, call the StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync method and specify the folder to be removed.

segment.source: You could use StorageLibrary.Folders and a ListView control (or similar) for the user to select a folder to remove.
segment.target: You could use StorageLibrary.Folders and a ListView control (or similar) for the user to select a folder to remove.

segment.source: When you call StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync, the user sees a confirmation dialog saying that the folder "won't appear in Pictures anymore, but won't be deleted."
segment.target: When you call StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync, the user sees a confirmation dialog saying that the folder "won't appear in Pictures anymore, but won't be deleted."

segment.source: What this means is that the folder remains in its original location on disk, is removed from the StorageLibrary.Folders property, and will no longer included in the built-in Photos app.
segment.target: What this means is that the folder remains in its original location on disk, is removed from the StorageLibrary.Folders property, and will no longer included in the built-in Photos app.

segment.source: The following example assumes that the user has selected the folder to remove from a ListView control named lvPictureFolders.
segment.target: The following example assumes that the user has selected the folder to remove from a ListView control named lvPictureFolders.

segment.source: Get notified of changes to the list of folders in a library
segment.target: Get notified of changes to the list of folders in a library

segment.source: To get notified about changes to the list of folders in a library, register a handler for the StorageLibrary.DefinitionChanged event of the library.
segment.target: To get notified about changes to the list of folders in a library, register a handler for the StorageLibrary.DefinitionChanged event of the library.

segment.source: Media library folders
segment.target: Media library folders

segment.source: A device provides five predefined locations for users and apps to store media files.
segment.target: A device provides five predefined locations for users and apps to store media files.

segment.source: Built-in apps store both user-created media and downloaded media in these locations.
segment.target: Built-in apps store both user-created media and downloaded media in these locations.

segment.source: The locations are:
segment.target: The locations are:

segment.source: Pictures folder.
segment.target: Pictures folder.

segment.source: Contains pictures.
segment.target: Contains pictures.

segment.source: Camera Roll folder.
segment.target: Camera Roll folder.

segment.source: Contains photos and video from the built-in camera.
segment.target: Contains photos and video from the built-in camera.

segment.source: Saved Pictures folder.
segment.target: Saved Pictures folder.

segment.source: Contains pictures that the user has saved from other apps.
segment.target: Contains pictures that the user has saved from other apps.

segment.source: Music folder.
segment.target: Music folder.

segment.source: Contains songs, podcasts, and audio books.
segment.target: Contains songs, podcasts, and audio books.

segment.source: Video folder.
segment.target: Video folder.

segment.source: Contains videos.
segment.target: Contains videos.

segment.source: Users or apps may also store media files outside the media library folders on the SD card.
segment.target: Users or apps may also store media files outside the media library folders on the SD card.

segment.source: To find a media file reliably on the SD card, scan the contents of the SD card, or ask the user to locate the file by using a file picker.
segment.target: To find a media file reliably on the SD card, scan the contents of the SD card, or ask the user to locate the file by using a file picker.

segment.source: For more info, see Access the SD card.
segment.target: For more info, see Access the SD card.

segment.source: Querying the media libraries
segment.target: Querying the media libraries

segment.source: Query results include both internal and removable storage
segment.target: Query results include both internal and removable storage

segment.source: Users can choose to store files by default on the optional SD card.
segment.target: Users can choose to store files by default on the optional SD card.

segment.source: Apps, however, can opt out of allowing files to be stored on the SD card.
segment.target: Apps, however, can opt out of allowing files to be stored on the SD card.

segment.source: As a result, the media libraries can be split across the device's internal storage and the SD card.
segment.target: As a result, the media libraries can be split across the device's internal storage and the SD card.

segment.source: You don't have to write additional code to handle this possibility.
segment.target: You don't have to write additional code to handle this possibility.

segment.source: The methods in the Windows.Storage namespace that query known folders transparently combine the query results from both locations.
segment.target: The methods in the Windows.Storage namespace that query known folders transparently combine the query results from both locations.

segment.source: You don't have to specify the removableStorage capability in the app manifest file to get these combined results, either.
segment.target: You don't have to specify the removableStorage capability in the app manifest file to get these combined results, either.

segment.source: Consider the state of the device's storage shown in the following image:
segment.target: Consider the state of the device's storage shown in the following image:

segment.source: images on the phone and sd card
segment.target: images on the phone and sd card

segment.source: If you query the contents of the Pictures Library by calling , the results include both internalPic.jpg and SDPic.jpg.
segment.target: If you query the contents of the Pictures Library by calling , the results include both internalPic.jpg and SDPic.jpg.

segment.source: Deep queries
segment.target: Deep queries

segment.source: Use the deep queries to enumerate the entire contents of a media library quickly.
segment.target: Use the deep queries to enumerate the entire contents of a media library quickly.

segment.source: The deep queries return only files of the specified media type.
segment.target: The deep queries return only files of the specified media type.

segment.source: For example, if you query the Music Library with a deep query, the query results do not include any picture files found in the Music folder.
segment.target: For example, if you query the Music Library with a deep query, the query results do not include any picture files found in the Music folder.

segment.source: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.
segment.target: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.

segment.source: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.
segment.target: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.

segment.source: The following deep queries are available:
segment.target: The following deep queries are available:

segment.source: Pictures library
segment.target: Pictures library

segment.source: Music library
segment.target: Music library

segment.source: Video library
segment.target: Video library

segment.source: Flat queries
segment.target: Flat queries

segment.source: To get a complete listing of all the files and folders in a library, call .
segment.target: To get a complete listing of all the files and folders in a library, call .

segment.source: This method returns all files in the library, regardless of their type.
segment.target: This method returns all files in the library, regardless of their type.

segment.source: This is a shallow query, so you have to enumerate the contents of subfolders recursively if the user has created subfolders in the library.
segment.target: This is a shallow query, so you have to enumerate the contents of subfolders recursively if the user has created subfolders in the library.

segment.source: Use flat queries to return media files of types that are not recognized by the built-in queries, or to return all the files in a library, including files that are not of the specified type.
segment.target: Use flat queries to return media files of types that are not recognized by the built-in queries, or to return all the files in a library, including files that are not of the specified type.

segment.source: For example, if you query the Music Library with a flat query, the query results include any picture files found by the query in the Music folder.
segment.target: For example, if you query the Music Library with a flat query, the query results include any picture files found by the query in the Music folder.

segment.source: Sample queries
segment.target: Sample queries

segment.target: Assume that the device and its optional SD card contain the folders and files shown in the following image:

segment.target: files on

segment.target: Here are a few examples of queries and the results that they return.

segment.source: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync();
segment.target: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync();

segment.source: No results.
segment.target: No results.

segment.source: This is flat query, and the Pictures folder does not contain any files as its immediate children.
segment.target: This is flat query, and the Pictures folder does not contain any files as its immediate children.

segment.source: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync(CommonFileQuery.OrderByDate);
segment.target: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync(CommonFileQuery.OrderByDate);

segment.source: Media library capabilities and file types
segment.target: Media library capabilities and file types

segment.source: Here are the capabilities that you can specify in the app manifest file to access media files in your app.
segment.target: Here are the capabilities that you can specify in the app manifest file to access media files in your app.

segment.target: Music.

segment.source: Working with photos
segment.target: Working with photos

segment.source: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.
segment.target: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.

segment.source: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.
segment.target: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.

segment.source: Opening a photo in the app that captured it
segment.target: Opening a photo in the app that captured it

segment.source: If you want to let the user open a photo again later in the app that captured it, you can save the CreatorAppId with the photo's metadata by using code similar to the following example.
segment.target: If you want to let the user open a photo again later in the app that captured it, you can save the CreatorAppId with the photo's metadata by using code similar to the following example.

segment.target: In this example, testPhoto is a StorageFile.

segment.source: Using stream methods to add a file to a media library
segment.target: Using stream methods to add a file to a media library

segment.source: When you access a media library by using a known folder such as KnownFolders.PictureLibrary, and you use stream methods to add a file to the media library, you have to make sure to close all the streams that your code opens.
segment.target: When you access a media library by using a known folder such as KnownFolders.PictureLibrary, and you use stream methods to add a file to the media library, you have to make sure to close all the streams that your code opens.

segment.source: Otherwise these methods fail to add the file to the media library as expected because at least one stream still has a handle to the file.
segment.target: Otherwise these methods fail to add the file to the media library as expected because at least one stream still has a handle to the file.

segment.source: For example, when you run the following code, the file is not added to the media library.
segment.target: For example, when you run the following code, the file is not added to the media library.

segment.source: In the line of code, , both the OpenAsync method and the GetOutputStreamAt method open a stream.
segment.target: In the line of code, , both the OpenAsync method and the GetOutputStreamAt method open a stream.

segment.source: However only the stream opened by the GetOutputStreamAt method is disposed as a result of the using statement.
segment.target: However only the stream opened by the GetOutputStreamAt method is disposed as a result of the using statement.

segment.source: The other stream remains open and prevents saving the file.
segment.target: The other stream remains open and prevents saving the file.

segment.source: To use stream methods successfully to add a file to the media library, make sure to close all the streams that your code opens, as shown in the following example.
segment.target: To use stream methods successfully to add a file to the media library, make sure to close all the streams that your code opens, as shown in the following example.
